numbered_ace_sentences: 1. Younger generations are more optimistic than older generations.
2. Less developed countries have a worse outlook on the future than more developed countries.
3. I wonder where the researchers asked people in these places.
4. I wonder if the researchers asked more upper-class people in suburbs.
5. I wonder if the researchers asked more lower-class people in slums.
6. It is important that the researchers cover all demographics of people.
7. I am a person in the population of the U.S.
8. I do not believe that this study is helpful.
9. Most older people say that things are getting worse.
10. Younger generations think that things are getting better.
11. The headline is: Is the world getting worse?
